election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1802 Governor

overview.note: Journal of the Pennsylvania State Senate from 1803 lists 47,939 total votes for Thomas MacKean and 17,058 total votes for James Ross.

sub_unit.name: Allegheny, Beaver and Butler
sub_unit.note: The Tree of Liberty (Pittsburgh, PA) lists Thomas MacKean with 2305 votes and James Ross with 594 votes.

sub_unit.name: Allegheny
sub_unit.note: The Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) list Thomas MacKean with 1336 votes and James Ross with 467 votes.

sub_unit.name: Middletown
sub_unit.note: The Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH) lists Thomas MacKean with 131 votes.

sub_unit.name: Noblestown
sub_unit.note: Noblestown is also known as Fayette township.

sub_unit.name: Reedsburg
sub_unit.note: Reedsburg is also known as Mifflin township.

sub_unit.name: Connequenessing
sub_unit.note: The Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH) lists Thomas MacKean with 187 votes.

sub_unit.name: Armstrong
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Register (Greensburg, PA) lists James Ross with 22 votes in Armstrong County and 129 in Westmoreland County, though the Official Returns list him with 161 combined votes in the two counties.

sub_unit.name: Bedford
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Register (Greenburg), Poulson's Daily American Advertiser, Scioto Gazette (Chillocothe) and Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) list Thomas MacKean with 882 votes.
The Pennsylvania State Journal lists Thomas MacKean with 883 votes and James Ross with 340 votes.

sub_unit.name: Chester
sub_unit.note: The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) list James Ross with 1928 votes.

sub_unit.name: Crawford, Erie, Mercer, Venango and Warren
Cumberland
sub_unit.note: Kline's Carlisle Weekly Gazette (Carlisle, PA) provides township totals, which add up to 227 votes for James Ross. The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) also list James Ross with 227 votes.

sub_unit.name: Carlisle
sub_unit.note: The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) lists James Ross with 148 votes.

sub_unit.name: Fayette
sub_unit.note: The Philadelphia Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA), Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) list Thomas MacKean with 1990 votes and James Ross with 424 votes.

sub_unit.name: Chambersburg
sub_unit.note: The Gazette of the United States lists James Ross with 119 votes.

sub_unit.name: Huntingdon
sub_unit.note: Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) on October 28 issued a correction in the vote for Governor from Huntingdon stating "...it was erroneously made 689 instead of 869. We will give the Governor his due."

sub_unit.name: Young's
sub_unit.note: "The Electors of Salisbury township have honored Mr. D. Buckley with six votes, for Governor. Query, Is this Compliment intended as prepatory for the next Governorship?" The Intelligencer, and Weekly Advertiser (Lancaster, PA). October 20, 1802.

sub_unit.name: Luzerne
sub_unit.note: The Luzerne Federalist: and Susquehannah Intelligencer (Wilkes-Barre, PA) provides township totals, which add up to Thomas MacKean with 278 votes and James Ross with 680 votes.

sub_unit.name: Rindaw
sub_unit.note: Rindaw township was also known as Rush township.

sub_unit.name: Armaugh and Derry
sub_unit.note: Armagh and Derry are two separate townships which voted together.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: "The following has been handed to us by a respectable correspondent, with an assurance that it is a correct statement of returns for this County." The Philadelphia Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). October 15, 1802.
The Examiner (Richmond, VA) lists James Ross with 1223 votes.

sub_unit.name: Northampton
sub_unit.note: The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) lists James Ross with 510 votes.

sub_unit.name: Northumberland
sub_unit.note: The Annals of Buffalo Valley, Pennsylvania: 1755-1855 reports the vote total for Thomas MacKean as 2674 and James Ross as 221, but the district totals provided are not exact and add up to 2643 for MacKean and 229 for Ross.
The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) list Thomas MacKean with 2774 votes.

sub_unit.name: Philadelphia
sub_unit.note: Journal of the Pennsylvania State Senate 1803, Page 54 and Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 30, 1802 combine the vote totals of Philadelphia city and Philadelphia county and report Thomas MacKean with 4638 votes and James Ross with 2296 votes.
Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) lists Thomas MacKean with 1943 votes.
Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) lists Thomas MacKean with 1948 votes.

sub_unit.name: Northern Liberties
sub_unit.note: Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and Gazette of the United States list Thomas MacKean With 1140 votes and James Ross with 263 votes.

sub_unit.name: York
sub_unit.note: Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) lists James Ross with 741 votes.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Pennsylvania State Archives, Harrisburg.
